Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
David Weiner Papers TAM 164
6 Linear Feet (6 boxes)
undated Materials are in English 1 2 3 4 5 6
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by David Weiner in 2003. The accession number associated with this gift is 2003.028.
Historical/Biographical Note
David Weiner (b. ca. 1912) was a member of the Teachers Union of New York, and subsequently, the United Federation of Teachers, where he was a member of the left-wing opposition group the Teachers Action Caucus. Weiner also was active in the retired teachers chapter of the UFT, and at one time edited its newsletter.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; David Weiner Papers; TAM 164; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Teachers Action Caucus (United Federation of Teachers) (TAM 141)
United Action Caucus (American Federation of Teachers) (TAM 338)
Scope and Content Note
This collection contains material related to the United Federation of Teachers and its retired teachers' chapter, the Teachers Action Caucus, and public education-related topics.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by David Weiner were transferred to New York University in 2003 by David Weiner. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.
